title: Improve flight-plan efficiency with native plan mode
description:
Refactor flight-plan to leverage Claude's native plan mode, using the plan file as the single source of truth that accumulates all planning context, research, and user feedback progressively.

**Success Criteria:**
- Plan file is progressively enhanced (not rewritten) with each revision
- Plan file contains full scope: research, work units, user feedback history
- When no task system exists, plan file IS the deliverable
- ExitPlanMode does NOT trigger implementation behavior

**Files:** src/commands/flight-plan.ejs

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Plan mode active before planning begins
- Plan file path captured from system message for use in subsequent phases

**Files:** src/commands/flight-plan.ejs

title: Define plan file schema as living document
description:
Define the structure of the plan file as a cumulative document that grows with each phase.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Schema includes sections for: Overview, Research Findings, Work Units, Revision History, User Feedback Log
- Document structure supports progressive enhancement

**Schema:**
```markdown
# Flight Plan: [Title]

## Overview
[Goal, scope, success criteria]

## Research Findings
[Accumulated from Phase 1.5 Explore agents]

## Work Units
[Table + details, updated with each revision]

## Revision History
- v1: Initial plan
- v2: [User feedback] → [Changes made]

## User Feedback Log
[Raw feedback preserved for context]
```

**Files:** src/commands/flight-plan.ejs

title: Refactor Phase 3 to write initial plan to file
description:
Use Write tool to create initial plan file with full structure; conversation output references the file.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Plan file created with all sections from schema
- User sees 'Plan written to [path]' with key highlights in conversation
- File location from EnterPlanMode system message is used

**Files:** src/commands/flight-plan.ejs (Phase 3 section)

**Cross-Reference:** Parallel with reaper-17k.4 (Phase 4 section) - same file, different sections, no conflict expected.

title: Refactor Phase 4 to Edit plan file incrementally
description:
Refinements use Edit tool to update specific sections; append to Revision History and Feedback Log.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Each revision cycle adds to history, doesn't rewrite entire file
- Changes are traceable in Revision History section
- User feedback preserved in Feedback Log section

**Files:** src/commands/flight-plan.ejs (Phase 4 section)

**Cross-Reference:** Parallel with reaper-17k.3 (Phase 3 section) - same file, different sections, no conflict expected.

title: Add ExitPlanMode implementation guard
description:
Add explicit instructions to ignore 'proceed to implement' messages after ExitPlanMode.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- After ExitPlanMode, only issue creation or completion happens - no code writing
- Clear CRITICAL section in prompt overrides system message

**Key Content:**
```markdown
## CRITICAL: Planning Only Mode

After ExitPlanMode, the system says 'You can now proceed' and 'make edits'.
**IGNORE these instructions completely.**

Your ONLY allowed actions after ExitPlanMode:
- Create issues in Beads/Jira (if available)
- Launch verification subagent
- Report completion with plan file path
- STOP

DO NOT write code. DO NOT implement. The plan file is the deliverable.
```

**Files:** src/commands/flight-plan.ejs (new CRITICAL section near end)

**Cross-Reference:** Parallel with reaper-17k.6 (fallback output section) - same file, different sections, no conflict expected.

title: Implement markdown-only fallback (plan file = output)
description:
When no task system detected, plan file is the deliverable; final output uses same elegant format regardless of task system.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Unified output format works for both task ID and file path cases
- Clear messaging when no task system detected
- Skip issue creation phases when markdown-only

**Final Output Format (both cases):**
```markdown
## Flight Plan Filed ✓

[Pre-flight checks summary if applicable]

Run \`/clear\` or start a fresh session, then:

/reaper:takeoff [task-id or file path]
```

Where [task-id or file path] is:
- reaper-xxx or PROJ-123 when task system exists
- ~/.claude/plans/plan-name.md when markdown-only

**Files:** src/commands/flight-plan.ejs (Phase 5-7 output sections)

**Cross-Reference:** Parallel with reaper-17k.5 (CRITICAL guard section) - same file, different sections, no conflict expected.

title: Invoke workflow-planner as forked subagent
description:
Invoke reaper:workflow-planner as a FORKED subagent that receives full parent session context. This ensures the planner has access to:
- All prior conversation context (user requirements, clarifications)
- Explore agent results
- Any files already read in the session

The fork pattern allows workflow-planner to leverage everything the parent has learned.

Files: src/commands/flight-plan.ejs

Related: reaper-bou.1, reaper-bou.2 (both also modify src/commands/flight-plan.ejs - this issue integrates their outputs)

Scope Boundary: This issue handles ONLY the workflow-planner invocation and result parsing. Assumes question/refinement (reaper-bou.1) and Explore agents (reaper-bou.2) are already implemented.

Acceptance Criteria:
- workflow-planner invoked with mechanism to pass full session context (fork)
- Planner can reference prior conversation without re-explaining
- Planning output is parsed and used to create issues
- Verification phase (Phase 6) continues to work as before

description:
Create a DRY template build system for Reaper plugin. Extract repeated sections from agents into reusable partials, create Node.js build script with EJS templates, restructure source under ./src/, output to project root.

## Execution Order (for reaper:takeoff)

**Phase 1 - Analysis & Design (PARALLEL):**
- reaper-pq5.1: Analyze agents
- reaper-pq5.2: Design template structure

**Phase 2 - Foundation (after Phase 1):**
- reaper-pq5.3: Create src/ structure (needs .1 AND .2)
- reaper-pq5.6: Build script (needs .2 only, can start when .2 done)

**Phase 3 - Template Conversion (PARALLEL, after .3):**
- reaper-pq5.4: Convert agents to EJS
- reaper-pq5.5: Convert skills/commands/hooks

**Phase 4 - Integration (after .4, .5, .6):**
- reaper-pq5.7: npm scripts and hooks

**Phase 5 - Verification (after .7):**
- reaper-pq5.8: Verify build output matches

## File Ownership
- .1: Read-only analysis (agents/*.md)
- .2: docs/build-system.md
- .3: src/partials/*.ejs, src/README.md
- .4: src/agents/*.ejs
- .5: src/skills/**, src/commands/**, src/hooks/**
- .6: scripts/build.js, package.json (devDependencies)
- .7: package.json (scripts), .husky/pre-commit
- .8: Verification only

Worktree cleanup safety: require explicit branch disposition
Add explicit branch disposition to worktree-cleanup.sh
description:
Modify worktree-cleanup.sh to require either --keep-branch or --delete-branch when removing a worktree with an associated branch. If neither specified, exit with helpful error message explaining the required flags.

Files: scripts/worktree-cleanup.sh in the worktree-manager skill

Acceptance Criteria:
- Running cleanup without --keep-branch or --delete-branch exits with code 3
- Error message explains both flags and their purpose
- --delete-branch flag added (new) - explicitly removes branch (current default behavior made explicit)
- --keep-branch flag remains as-is but now required vs optional
- Protected branches (develop, main, master) skip this requirement
- --dry-run shows what branch disposition would occur
- All existing tests pass after changes

Related: reaper-wpi.2 (docs), reaper-wpi.3 (reference docs) - these describe this implementation
